title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9-8-7-6 points: Stronger

AN ESSAY IN THIS SCORE RANGE WILL ILLUSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS:

  1. Has a clear, well-developed thesis.

  2. Is well organized.

  3. Makes apt use of most documents, perhaps implicitly ("most" means more than half of the documents).

  4. Analyzes more than describes; for example, discusses sources' reliability and point of view, groups documents appropriately, and refers to historical context.

  5. May contain minor errors; even a "9" need not be flawless.

Indicators

  1. Distinguishes all three challenges (security, unity, prosperity); addresses each at least cursorily with reference to documents (may be implicit). The better essays make note of the roles of both France and England in issues of security and prosperity.

  2. Groups documents appropriately, referring at least implicitly to more than half of them.

  3. Recognizes a gradual weakening of the Dutch position (no penalty for over­ stating this point).

  4. Shows awareness of chronology (e.g., in attributing cause/effect, shifting role of England, and so on).

  5. Appropriately distinguishes among Dutch and foreign points of view; is aware that point of view (POV) is important.

  6. Makes generally correct use of background information.

5-4 points: Mixed

THESE SCORES SHOULD BE ASSIGNED JUDICIOUSLY. (Don't use as a dumping ground.)

  1. Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic.

  2. Addresses documents unevenly; makes appropriate use of some documents.

  3. Offers limited analysis, e.g., of sources' reliability and point of view.

  4. May contain errors, factual and/or interpretive.

Indicators

  1. Addresses the challenges to the Dutch, perhaps not clearly distinguishing among them or developing them extensively; or is seriously imbalanced in treatment.

  2. Uses documents appropriately, referring to several (if only implicitly).

  3. Provides extremely limited documentary support for its assertions.

  4. Acknowledges authorship (Dutch/foreign) if only in passing and partially.

  5. Offers limited analysis, e.g., in grouping documents, identifying POV, or acknowledging fluctuations over time.

3-2-1-0 points: Weaker

AN ESSAY IN THIS SCORE RANGE WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES TO VARYING DEGREES. ESSAYS SCORED 0 OR 1 MAY ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION, BUT FAIL TO DO SO ADEQUATELY.

  1. Thesis confused, unfocused, or absent, or simply restates question.

  2. Discusses or lists documents superficially with little or no analysis (laundry list), or no reference to documents.

  3. May contain major errors.

Indicators

  1. May discuss no more than one challenge.

  2. Simply cites documents as documents; i.e., without attribution or sense of POV.

  3. May not have a focus; discussion generally disorganized.

  4. May repeat historical background statement with minimal reference to documents.

  5. Substantially off task.

— Non-responsive

Response totally off-task, absent, or irrelevant.

NOTE: A major misinterpretation or misuse of one or two documents may be used to justify a reduction of score within stronger and weaker essays.
